$!You must tell DVLA if you have seizures or epilepsy relating to déjà vu.$!

%You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don’t tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you’re involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted.%

##Car or motorcycle licence##

You only need to tell DVLA if your déjà vu is related to seizures or epilepsy. Check with your doctor if you're not sure. If it is, fill in form FEP1 and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.


$D
[Download 'FEP1 - Confidential medical information' (PDF, 247KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_178630.pdf "Download medical questionnaire'"){:rel="external"}
$D

##Bus, coach or lorry licence##

You only need to tell DVLA if your déjà vu is related to seizures or epilepsy. Check with your doctor if you're not sure. If it is, fill in form FEP1V and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

$D
[Download 'FEP1V - Confidential medical information' (PDF, 340KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_185934.pdf "Download medical questionnaire'"){:rel="external"}
$D

*[DVLA]: Driver Vehicle and Licensing Agency
overview: You must tell DVLA if you have seizures or epilepsy relating to déjà vu - download the correct form to let them know
title: Déjà vu and driving
